instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V05_SUS: What is PP1V05_SUS? The PP1V05_SUS signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that supplies 1.05 volts, typically used in a suspended (SUS) state of the laptop. This state is a low-power mode where essential system functions are maintained, but the majority of the system is powered down..
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance – this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
Hey ,

Working on 2936 b motherboard with liquid damage near SMC, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and some asshole touch on <TRANSISTOR>Q9425</TRANSISTOR> + <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR>!!
u
initial the board don't turn on because PPBUS = 12.3V .. i replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> + SMC and board was working well until i plug the battery. After that the board don't turn on and i noticed that <CHIP>U9480</CHIP> was hot.. i found <CHIP>U9330</CHIP> shorted replaced and short gone!! Now, the board start up normally but without image.. Not light on PENDRIVER!!

<TRANSISTOR>Q9425</TRANSISTOR> + <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> replaced and i have a working board and test in diode mode all pin's and have same values compare with a working board!

PPBUS = 12.67V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0.9V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_SUS</SIGNAL> - 1.05v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> - 1.055v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.151

already replace a bios for new one with clean me no changes.. I don't touch in original one!

any suggestion ??

thank's

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
"board start up normally but without image"
What about backlight?

Surelly no USB activity?
Tested different RAM modules?

"<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.151"
It should drop under 1V after few seconds; for a working board...

You must have corrosion problem still.

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
backing on this one, 

i'm sure, i don't have activity on USB! Already tested diferent rams on 2 <SIGNAL>RAM_MODULES</SIGNAL>! 

<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 1.151V don't drop to 1V ... keep on 1.151V. 

already put the board on ultrasonic!! but no change. you have more ideas ?? 

thanks

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
So something happened when connected battery.
Battery bus is common for <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and SMC; one of them could be bad now.
Test resistance to ground at SCL/SDA, and voltage too (battery connected).
Does it charge the battery?

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
Ya, this one before i touch boot's well to operation system but with the battery problem! 

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> - 425v DIODE MODE 
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> - 425v DIODE MODE 

I have 11.54V on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> with charger connect! It's normal <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> goes to 11.54V with battery and charger connect ? 

i think the battery is charging, the light goes orange when i plug the battery and when i take off the charger the fan keep working!!

threads.title: 820 2936 b, No image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should increase bit a bit, if battery is charging.
Once battery is fully charged (100%), <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> should go to 12.5V and magsafe switch back to green..
